e4: Change to a new and ethical policy of unbiased reporting is recommended to promote integrity, protect against potential future legal liabilities or investigations, and uphold fiduciary duties. Investor confusion can be addressed in proactive communications from Board and IR while ensuring fairness for all investors is the responsibility of corporate governance.
e5: A ethical reporting policy should accurately represent financial position and performances in accordance with GAAP, transparent, honest and comply with applicable regulations and securities law. A transparent disclosure of material information that impacts current/future earnings capacity is imperative to promote accountability and ensure market efficiency to protect investors interest, reducing potential for legal troubles and violations. It will be crucial in case of change in policies, to engage with investor relations strategically, communicating the reason and advantage clearly to maintain market confidence.
e6: Additionally, I request clarity from the CFO and management team on the consequences for current earnings over-reporting on key performance indicators such cash flow, gross margins and operating expenses going forward; assurances that they're working on a comprehensive Investor Relations strategy to handle changes as well as clear communication with the SEC regarding any changes in financial policies.}
